alert.note: Alert for Berrien (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 30 at 2:24PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of south central Georgia, including the following counties, Berrien, Colquitt and Cook. * WHEN...Until 345 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 222 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated between 3 and 6 inches of rain have fallen. Minor flooding is underway. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Nashville, Adel, Sparks, Enigma, Ray City, Lenox, Alapaha, Berlin, Cecil, Ellenton, Massee, Cottle, Laconte, Barneyville, Wagon Wheel, Staunton, Berrien Co A/P, Cook Co A/P, Flat Ford and New Lois. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
